text: The 2015–16 Winnipeg Jets season was the 17th season for the National Hockey League franchise that was established on June 25, 1997, and the fifth in Winnipeg, Manitoba, since the franchise relocated from Atlanta prior to the start of the 2011–12 NHL season. ==Schedule and results== ===Pre-season=== {| class="toccolours collapsible collapsed" style="width:90%; clear:both; margin:1.5em auto; text-align:center;" |- ! colspan=10 style="background:#fff; border-top:#002D62 5px solid; border-bottom:#8D8D8F 5px solid;" | 2015 Pre- Season Game Log: 3–2–2 (Home: 2–0–2 ; Road: 1–2–0) |- style="text- align:center; background:#ddd;" ! # !! College/Junior/Club Team (League) |- | style="text-align:center"| 1 | style="text-align:center"| 17 | Kyle Connor | Left Wing | United States | Youngstown Phantoms (USHL) |- | style="text-align:center"| 1 | style="text- align:center"| 25 | Jack Roslovic | Centre | United States | U.S. National Team Development Program |- | style="text-align:center"| 2 | style="text- align:center"| 47 | Jansen Harkins | Centre | Canada | Prince George Cougars (WHL) |- | style="text-align:center"| 3 | style="text-align:center"| 78 | Erik Foley | Left Wing | United States | Cedar Rapids Roughriders (USHL) |- | style="text-align:center"| 4 | style="text-align:center"| 108 | Michael Spacek | Right Wing | Czech Republic | HC Pardubice (Czech) |- | style="text- align:center"| 6 | style="text-align:center"| 168 | Mason Appleton | Centre | United States | Tri-City Storm (USHL) |- | style="text-align:center"| 7 | style="text-align:center"| 198 | Sami Niku | Defense | Finland | JYP (Liiga) |- | style="text-align:center"| 7 | style="text-align:center"| 203 | Matteo Gennaro | Centre | Canada | Prince Albert Raiders (WHL) |} ;Draft notes * The Sabres' first-round pick went to the Winnipeg Jets as the result of a trade on February 11, 2015 that sent Evander Kane, Zach Bogosian and Jason Kasdorf to Buffalo in exchange for Tyler Myers, Drew Stafford, Joel Armia, Brendan Lemieux and this pick (being conditional at the time of the trade). The condition – Winnipeg will receive the lowest of Buffalo's first-round picks in 2015 – was converted on April 27, 2015 when the Islanders were eliminated from the 2015 Stanley Cup playoffs, ensuring that the Blues' first-round pick would be lower. * The Winnipeg Jets' fifth-round pick went to the Carolina Hurricanes as the result of a trade on February 25, 2015 that sent Jiri Tlusty to Winnipeg in exchange for a third-round pick in 2016 and this pick (being conditional at the time of the trade). The condition – Carolina will receive a fifth-round pick in 2015 if Winnipeg qualifies for the 2015 Stanley Cup playoffs – was converted on April 9, 2015. * The Washington Capitals' seventh- round pick went to the Winnipeg Jets as the result of a trade on June 28, 2014 that sent Edward Pasquale and a sixth-round pick in 2014 to Washington in exchange for a sixth-round pick in 2014, Nashville's seventh-round pick in 2014 and this pick. ==References== Category:Winnipeg Jets seasons Winnipeg Jets season, 2015-16 Winni
